question.title: Javalin dependency does not load from Maven repo due to CVE
question.body:
I'm trying to use Javalin in a new project I'm working on but every version of Javain has a dependency containing a CVE, and thus, none of the Javalin JAR versions can be downloaded from mvnrepository.

The problem appears to be centered around the webdrivermanager dependency. Here is the vulnerability stated on mvnrepository:

This vulnerability is associated with program files src/main/java/io/github/bonigarcia/wdm/WebDriverManager.java. This issue affects webdrivermanager: from 1.0.0 before 6.0.2.

Looking at the latest version of Javain, its POM shows it is using a version more recent than 6.0.2

<webdrivermanager.version>6.3.2</webdrivermanager.version>

And, like the error message above states, the CVE seems to have been fixed as of version 6.0.2 in WebDriverManager. So, why is this JAR shown as vulnerable/undownloadable? And, how do I fix it?

answers.body: I appreciate all your assistance on this. The Javalin uber pom contains a property that contains: <webdrivermanager.version>6.3.2</webdrivermanager.version>. Doing a mvn dependency:tree shows it IS using 6.3.2. Now, here is the capper: When I run in IntelliJ using the bundled Maven, the dependency doesn't download. But, I tried it from the terminal and it DID download. The Maven running from terminal is up to date. The version bundled with IntelliJ is down 2 point releases (3.9.11 vs 3.9.9). Anyway, I'm up and running now. Thanks!

question_comments.body: Sounds like a proxy issue in IDE.
@Todd you could add it as an answer as this is answered now.

@andrewJames - I appreciate all your assistance on this.  The Javalin uber pom contains a property that contains:  <webdrivermanager.version>6.3.2</webdrivermanager.version>.  Doing a mvn dependency:tree shows it IS using 6.3.2.  Now, here is the capper:  When I run in IntelliJ using the bundled Maven, the dependency doesn't download.  But, I tried it from the terminal and it DID download.  The Maven running from terminal is up to date.  The version bundled with IntelliJ is down 2 point releases (3.9.11 vs 3.9.9).  Anyway, I'm up and running now.  Thanks!

Clarification: I can see here (scroll down this page) that Javalin v6.7.0 is using v6.0.0 of that webdrivernamager library - so, yes, Javalin would need to upgrade to a fixed version to remove the vulnerability warning. Apart from that, can you check your POM is valid, and that you are not using anything like this - either in your POM or in a parent POM (if you have one). Without a minimal reproducible example this is just a guess, though.
@Todd just checked and it downloads just fine for me. What kind of problem do you see and can you provide some configuration that would reproduce the issue?

@andrewJames, Thanks for the responses.  It is not an in-house policy/prohibition.  It seems to be a mvnrepository prohibition.  I included the dependency in my POM, but it doesn't download from mvnrepository.
And, how do I fix it? Well, the problem is in a library which is only used for Javalin internal testing. So they are affected; but you should not be. You could ask the Javalin team for clarification.

"thus, the none of the Javain [sic] JAR versions can be downloaded" - For clarity, are you referring to some in-house policy/prohibition you have? There is nothing stopping you from downloading the JARs from Maven. "why is this JAR shown as vulnerable/undownloadable?" I don't know. If it really is fixed, then maybe the CVE was mis-reported against the wrong version(s) of the library.
